at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common

Class SimpleData

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common.SimpleData

  • public class SimpleData
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple data container, containing the current information about a single buffer. This may be the newest value gathered from a sensor or the last value sent to an actor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Initialisation of the data container.

      Initialisation of the data container.

    • Method Detail

      • getBufferName

        public java.lang.String getBufferName()
        This method returns the name of the buffer, which this object belongs to.
        Returns:
        the name of the buffer. This name isn't null.

      • getState

        public BufferState getState()
        This method returns state of the buffer.
        Returns:
        the buffer state (it isn't null)

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Number getValue()
        This method returns the gathered value of the buffer.
        Returns:
        the gathered value. It is nonnull if the buffer state is BufferState.READY and null in any other cases.

      • getTimestamp

        public java.util.Date getTimestamp()

        This method returns the date and time, when the buffer reached this state or gathered the value.

        This timestamp is created in the buffer process, which doesn't run in this JVM. Therefore the timestamp may not be meaningful, if the JVM of the buffer process runs on an other hardware as this JVM. The content of the timestamp depends on the kind of buffer and the buffer state, but it is never null.

        Returns:
        the timestamp as date and time (it isn't null in any case)
